revised_title: Chemical Pigments in Pierid Butterflies: A Study of Lepidotic Acid and Related Substances
tldr: The author investigates the chemical pigments in Pierid butterflies, specifically focusing on lepidotic acid and related uric acid derivatives. The study demonstrates the identity of natural and artificial pigments and discusses their probable constitution. The author also observes that these pigments are unique to the Pierid group among Rhopalocera and that different pigments are used in mimicry between different butterfly species.
